Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock hit three successive sixes in the fourth over.
Andries Gous hit back-to-back sixes in the 18th over.
Kagiso Rabada removed Steven Taylor with his third ball.
Gous and Harmeet shared a sixth-wicket stand of 91.
Harmeet Singh hit a full toss to Tristan Stubbs at midwicket, ending the partnership.
Pre-Game Insights: De Kock's first half-century of the tournament set South Africa up.
South African born Andries Gous very nearly had a decisive say on proceedings.
Post-Match Reflections: De Kock expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gous made his international debut three months ago.
De Kock's highest T20 World Cup score: 74.
Others: South Africa's highest Powerplay of the tournament before this match was 64 for 1.
